add-action-action.description: Button to add an action (movement related, e.g. clapping)

bluetooth-unsupported-advice.defaultMessage: We recommend Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge so you can connect directly to your micro:bit.

bluetooth-unsupported-explain.defaultMessage: Unfortunately, WebUSB and Web Bluetooth are not supported by this browser. This means you cannot connect to a micro:bit to record the data samples needed to train a machine learning model.

certainty-percentage-label.description: Label for certainty of an action

certainty-tooltip.defaultMessage: How confident the model is that you are currently doing each action.

code-download-error.description: Title for error message relating to project loading

code-tooltip.defaultMessage: These are the MakeCode blocks for each detected action when you transfer your ML model and code to a micro:bit

firmware-outdated-content1.defaultMessage: Connecting to the micro:bit failed because the firmware on your micro:bit is too old.

firmware-outdated-content2.defaultMessage: You must <link>update your firmware</link> before you can connect to this micro:bit.

help-support.description: Link or menu item link to support site

homepage-alt.defaultMessage: graph showing x, y, z graph lines representing micro:bit accelerometer data
homepage-alt.description: Alt text for image in homepage

homepage-description.defaultMessage: Train a machine learning model on your own movement data and run it on your micro:bit.

homepage-subtitle.defaultMessage: Create AI on your BBC micro:bit using movement and machine learning.

homepage-video-prompt.defaultMessage: Watch the video to learn how to use {appNameFull}.
homepage-video-prompt.description: Prompt to watch the video on the home page

incompatible-device-body-alt.defaultMessage: Go back to select a different micro:bit, or <link>save the project hex</link> which can be downloaded onto a micro:bit V2 later.

incompatible-device-body1.defaultMessage: Continue to MakeCode to edit the program. You can then save the project hex which can be downloaded onto a micro:bit V2.

incompatible-device-body2.defaultMessage: Alternatively, <link>save the project hex</link> without using MakeCode.

incompatible-device-subtitle.defaultMessage: You are using a micro:bit V1, but machine learning projects need the faster processor on a micro:bit V2. <link>Learn more about micro:bit versions.</link>

insufficient-data-body.defaultMessage: You need at least 3 data samples for 2 actions to train the model.

live-graph-tooltip.defaultMessage: This graph shows movement data from the micro:bit's accelerometer in real time. Try moving your data collection micro:bit to see the X, Y and Z axes change. Each coloured line represents a different direction (dimension) you are moving the micro:bit in.

makecode-back-alt.defaultMessage: Left arrow icon for MakeCode back

makecode-block-default-alt.defaultMessage: MakeCode block: on ML {actionName} start, show icon {iconName}

makecode-block-on-ML.description: Makecode block text. The translation should match MakeCode translations.

makecode-block-show-icon.description: Makecode block text. The translation should match MakeCode translations.

makecode-block-start.description: Makecode block text. The translation should match MakeCode translations.

microbit-not-connected.description: Live graph disconnected micro:bit status message

more-edit-in-makecode-options.description: Aria label for the additional actions menu to the right of the Edit in MakeCode button

name-action-hint.defaultMessage: Name an action you want the micro:bit to recognise
name-action-hint.description: Hint shown when you have an unnamed action

name-used-when.defaultMessage: The name is used when you save a file.

new-session-setup-description.defaultMessage: Starting a new session will overwrite your existing session. You may want to <link>save your existing session</link> first.

newpage-continue-session-subtitle.defaultMessage: Use a hex file or data samples file you saved to your computer to continue a session.

newpage-new-session-subtitle.defaultMessage: Connect your micro:bit and collect movement data to build a machine learning model.

newpage-section-one-title.defaultMessage: Pick up where you left off

next-action.description: Next button text for dialogs and similar

no-data-samples.description: Empty data samples page status text

open-file-dropped.description: Aria label for file drop target

other-tabs-body1.defaultMessage: Another process is connected to this device.

other-tabs-body2.defaultMessage: Close any other tabs that may be using WebUSB (e.g. MakeCode, Python Editor, {appNameShort}), or unplug and replug the micro:bit before trying again.

project-name-not-empty.defaultMessage: The project name cannot be empty

radio-link-microbit-label.defaultMessage: diagram showing radio link micro:bit being connected with a computer
radio-link-microbit-label.description: Aria label for radio link image

recognition-point-label.description: Label for the slider for the recognition point

reconnect-action.description: Button text to reconnect a micro:bit over Bluetooth/radio

reconnect-failed-bluetooth1.defaultMessage: The connection to the data collection micro:bit could not be re-established.

reconnect-failed-bridge1.defaultMessage: The connection to the micro:bit connected to your computer could not be re-established.

reconnect-failed-remote-heading.defaultMessage: Failed to reconnect to data collection micro:bit

reconnect-failed-remote1.defaultMessage: The connection to the data collection micro:bit could not be re-established.

reconnect-failed-subtitle.defaultMessage: Follow these instructions to restart the connection process.

record-hint.defaultMessage: Press to record a data sample or press button B on your data collection micro:bit.
record-hint.description: Hint when you have named the first action but not recorded any data samples

recording-fingerprint-label.defaultMessage: heatmap showing micro:bit x, y, z accelerometer data features for one recording

recording-graph-label.defaultMessage: graph showing micro:bit x, y, z accelerometer data for one recording

reset-to-default-action.description: Reset to default blocks button text

save-action.description: Label for action that saves the project as a file the user downloads

save-hex-dialog-heading.defaultMessage: Save project as a hex file
save-hex-dialog-heading.description: Heading for the dialog shown when saving a hex file

save-hex-dialog-message1.defaultMessage: The download contains your actions, data samples and your MakeCode project. Open it in {appNameFull} to continue working.
save-hex-dialog-message1.description: Text in the dialog shown when saving a hex file

save-hex-dialog-message2.defaultMessage: You can also open it with Microsoft MakeCode if you don't need to change the actions and data samples.
save-hex-dialog-message2.description: Text in the dialog shown when saving a hex file

saving-description.defaultMessage: Your download will be ready soon.

saving-toast-title.defaultMessage: Your hex file has been downloaded
saving-toast-title.description: Notification after a hex file has been downloaded

settings-menu-action.description: Label for settings actions menu button

steps-alt.defaultMessage: diagram showing the iterative process of collecting data, training a model, testing the model, and improving the model by improving the data collected before finally coding using the model.
steps-alt.description: Alt text for the step-by-step home page diagram

terms.description: Link or menu item link to view terms of use

tour-collectData-addActions-content.defaultMessage: Decide what your other actions will be and what you will name them. You need at least 2 actions with 3 data samples to train the model. Your data samples are only stored on your computer, they do not get sent to anyone else.

tour-collectData-afterFirst-content.defaultMessage: To train the machine learning model you need at least 3 data samples for 2 different actions.

tour-collectData-collectMore-content.defaultMessage: Record more samples for this action. Collecting more samples should result in a better machine learning model.

tour-collectData-trainModel-content.defaultMessage: When you have collected enough data samples you can train the machine learning model. You can come back later to remove or add more data and re-train to make the model more reliable.

tour-dataSamples-actions-content.defaultMessage: An action is the type of movement you want the machine learning model to recognise e.g. ‘waving’ or ‘clapping’. Decide what your first action will be, name it and then start recording data samples.

tour-dataSamples-connected-content.defaultMessage: Now you can start collecting data samples to train a machine learning (ML) model to recognise different movements, or actions.

tour-dataSamples-connected-title.defaultMessage: Your data collection micro:bit is connected!

tour-dataSamples-liveGraph-content.defaultMessage: The graph shows movement data from the micro:bit’s accelerometer. Move your data collection micro:bit and see how the graph changes.

tour-makecode-intro-content1.defaultMessage: Download the model and code to test your project on a micro:bit. You can also add more code blocks to create your own programs using your model.

tour-makecode-intro-content2.defaultMessage: Need to improve the ML model?

tour-makecode-intro-content3.defaultMessage: Use this back button in the top left.

tour-testModel-afterTrain-content.defaultMessage: Now test your machine learning model. Try each action by moving your data collection micro:bit. Does the model correctly estimate each action?

tour-testModel-certaintyRecognition-cont.defaultMessage: The bar graph shows how confident the model is that you are doing each action. Move the slider to adjust the recognition point, or threshold.

tour-testModel-editInMakeCode-content.defaultMessage: Open your project in MakeCode to download the program and your machine learning model to a micro:bit. You can add more blocks to create your own programs using your model.

tour-testModel-estimatedAction-content.defaultMessage: The action the model estimates you are currently doing is shown below the micro:bit icon for that action.

tour-testModel-makeCodeBlocks-content.defaultMessage: These MakeCode blocks will show icons for each action detected when you transfer your code and model to a micro:bit.

train-description.defaultMessage: The computer program spots patterns or differences in your data samples, and uses these to build a mathematical model that allows {appNameFull} to recognise different actions when you move your micro:bit.

train-error-body.defaultMessage: The training did not result in a usable model. The reason for this is most likely the data used for training. If the data samples for different actions are too similar, this can result in issues in the training process.

train-error-todo.defaultMessage: Return to the Add data page and change your data.

transfer-hex-alt.defaultMessage: animation of dragging a hex file from the downloads folder onto the micro:bit drive or device listed in the file explorer

transfer-hex-heading.defaultMessage: Transfer saved hex file to micro:bit

transfer-hex-manual-download.defaultMessage: If the file did not automatically download then <link>please download the file here</link>.

transfer-hex-message.defaultMessage: Drag the hex file from your Downloads folder to the MICROBIT drive.

unplug-radio-link-microbit-description.defaultMessage: Unplug the radio link micro:bit from the computer. You will need to reconnect the micro:bit if you want to record more data samples.
unplug-radio-link-microbit-description.description: Unplug radio link micro:bit dialog description

unplug-radio-link-microbit-label.defaultMessage: animation showing a USB cable being disconnected from the top of a micro:bit
unplug-radio-link-microbit-label.description: Unplug radio link micro:bit dialog aria label

unplug-radio-link-microbit-title.description: Unplug radio link micro:bit dialog title

unsupported-device-explain.defaultMessage: Unfortunately, we only support using micro:bit V2 when connecting using micro:bit radio. You have connected a <link>micro:bit V1</link>.

unsupported-device-header.defaultMessage: micro:bit radio connections do not support micro:bit V1

unsupported-device-with-bluetooth.defaultMessage: Please use Web Bluetooth to connect to your micro:bit V1 instead.

unsupported-device-without-bluetooth.defaultMessage: You can connect to micro:bit V1 using Web Bluetooth, however, this browser or device does not have Bluetooth enabled. <link>How to enable Bluetooth</link>.

webusb-retry-no-select.defaultMessage: You didn't select a micro:bit. Do you want to try again?
webusb-retry-no-select.description: Shown if the user fails to choose a micro:bit

webusb-retry-replug3.defaultMessage: check that this micro:bit does not have a battery pack connected

webusb-retry-replug4.defaultMessage: unplug and replug the USB cable
